1 Samuel or 1 Kings__08.7__Rejected: : The government of Israel hitherto had been a theocracy, in which God himself immediately ruled, by laws which he had enacted, and by judges extraordinarily raised up by himself; and therefore he complains that his people rejected him, in desiring a change of government.
1 Samuel or 1 Kings__08.9__The right: : That is, the manner (misphat) after which he shall proceed, having no one to control him, when he has the power in his hand.
